snippet: A policy to deal with a record number of asylum seekers would deny permission to settle in the country to anyone who arrived by boat without a visa.
abstract: Australian Prime Min Kevin Rudd announces tough new policy to curtail record number of people trying the dangerous boat journey to claim asylum in the country, saying that no one who arrives by boat without a visa will ever be granted permission to settle in Australia.

byline.contributor: Joe Cochrane contributed reporting from Jakarta, Indonesia.

lead_paragraph: A policy to deal with a record number of asylum seekers would deny permission to settle in the country to anyone who arrived by boat without a visa.

headline.main: Australia Adopts Tough Measures to Curb Asylum Seekers
headline.print_headline: Australia Moves to Curb Asylum Seekers
